summary: This is an email or memo from September 16, 2021, documenting a call with Cindy Hopkins regarding the authentication of an old transcript. The discussion involves locating the original transcript via a former agency owner, Toni Salopec, and an alternative authentication method using a video recorded by Stan Sanders of Visual Evidence.

persons.name: Cindy Hopkins
persons.context: She is the subject of the call and is discussing methods to authenticate an old transcript, including contacting Stan Sanders to review a video.

persons.name: Toni Salopec
persons.context: Described as the agency owner Cindy Hopkins worked with at the time, who would have kept the original transcript in her files but no longer has it due to its age.

persons.name: Stan Sanders
persons.context: Recorded a video of the transcript in question; Cindy Hopkins plans to contact him to review the video as an alternative method of authentication.

connections.description: Cindy Hopkins worked with Toni Salopec, who was the agency owner at the time and would have maintained the original transcript files.
Cindy Hopkins plans to contact Stan Sanders to review a video he recorded, which could be used to authenticate the transcript.

events.title: Call with Cindy Hopkins regarding transcript authentication
events.description: A call took place with FBI Special Agent Cindy Hopkins to discuss methods for authenticating an old transcript, including locating the original via Toni Salopec or using a video recorded by Stan Sanders.

keyFacts: The document records a call on September 16, 2021, concerning the authentication of an old transcript related to the Epstein case.
The original transcript was reportedly held by agency owner Toni Salopec, but it is no longer available due to its age.
An alternative authentication method involves reviewing a video of the transcript recorded by Stan Sanders of Visual Evidence.
The document is subject to a protective order covering specific paragraphs (7, 8, 9, 10, 15, and 17).
